full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 749 Filed 08/10/22 Page 232 of 236 1136 LC3KMAX8

1 MS. MOE: Your Honor, would the end of the day of midnight on Saturday be acceptable to the Court on timing?
2 midnight on Saturday be acceptable to the Court on timing?
3 THE COURT: Let's do 8:00 o'clock on Saturday for the government, 8:00 o'clock on Sunday for the defense, I'll take between 8:00 p.m. and Monday morning to read your papers and resolve it.
4 government, 8:00 o'clock on Sunday for the defense, I'll take between 8:00 p.m. and Monday morning to read your papers and resolve it.
5 MS. MOE: Thank you, your Honor.
6 THE COURT: Okay, Mr. Everdell?
7 MR. EVERDELL: That's fine for the defense.
8 THE COURT: I received the first round of briefing on the attorney-client privilege issue from the defense.
9 So the government's is due when?
10 MR. ROHRBACH: Our brief is due on Monday right now, your Honor.
11 THE COURT: On Monday? I wanted to indicate, I know you raised that the witness' attorney might want to weigh in. So if they do, you can convey that they could put in a letter at that same timing.
12 MR. ROHRBACH: We will. Thank you, your Honor.
13 THE COURT: Okay.
14 Redaction issues: As I indicated, I do want the video reviewed and a public version.
15 I want to encourage also, I think a lot of the photos that came in, a lot of the exhibits that came in, could have redacted versions so that just the images of the witnesses who
16 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00012746
